A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
There is a lot of insta-hate from longtime fans who really don't like that their 'God' Luke Skywalker might actually be a human being after all\, and does have flaws and weaknesses like everyone else. Oh\, and god forbid a woman can be a powerful force wielder! Seriously? Get a hold of yourselves.

I watched this with a star wars fan who is not burdened with years of re-watching the same 7 films time and time again (an 11 year old child). He loved it\, although some of the subtleties of the storytelling did pass him by.

It is not a perfect film as several plot holes make their presence felt. Villians act stupid\, common sense is ignored for a good film moment and shots are held a few seconds too long to ensure we get the point.

At one point\, too many things are happening at once in three separate storylines and the director/editing just can't get it onto the screen in a satisfactory manner.

Flaws aside\, I did enjoy it on the second showing and will get the BluRay and the t-shirt and watch the next film. Yes it is Star Wars.
